document.masterDocTitle: Species review of the genus Gnypeta Thomson from Canada, Alaska and Greenland (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Aleocharinae): systematics, bionomics and distribution

subSubSection.paragraph: Specimens are listed in Appendix A.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 148-155. Genital structures of
Gnypeta helenae
: 148, median lobe of the aedeagus in lateral view, 149, dorsal view; 150, paramere; 151, male tergite 8; 152, male sternite 8; 153, spermatheca; 154, female tergite 8; 155, female sternite 8.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnypeta helenae
is a western Nearctic species recorded from Montana ( Casey 1906 ), and also recorded under two synonymic names from Arizona and Oregon ( Casey 1906 ; Moore and Legner 1975 ). We report this species for the first time from Canada in Alberta and British Columbia .

Adults were collected in June, July, August and October, some from silt around
Typha
on a river bank.

The late Gustav Adolf Lohse ( Hamburg , Germany ) worked on revision of Nearctic
Gnypeta
but was not able to complete his project. One CNC specimen of this species bears his identification label as “
G. glabra Lohse
” [manuscript name].
